intro: Cadia varia, commonly known as the variable cadia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
